meanings.definition: The state or quality of being productive.
meanings.sent1: Her productivity at work impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: The productivity of the team increased after the new software was implemented.
meanings.sent3: The productivity of the ants in gathering food was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent4: The productivity of the factory was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The productivity of the garden was evident in the abundance of fruits and vegetables.

meanings.definition: The effectiveness of productive effort, especially in industry, as measured in terms of the rate of output per unit of input.
meanings.sent1: The company's productivity was evident in the high number of products manufactured daily.
meanings.sent2: The productivity of the workers was crucial for meeting the production targets.
meanings.sent3: The productivity of the robot vacuum cleaner amazed the family's pet cat.
meanings.sent4: The productivity of the assembly line was like a symphony of efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The productivity of the solar panels was clear from the amount of energy generated each day.
